text: this is the right hemisphere of a human
brain one of hundreds of brains donated
for medical research in the UK every
year - one of ten brain banks now if I
pick it up intact the human brain weighs
around three pounds or one and a half
kilos it makes up just 2% of the body's
weight and yet consumes 20% of the
body's energy contains a hundred billion
nerve cells or neurons each neuron has
10,000 connections making a brain
network of a thousand trillion
connections now that's more complex than
any supercomputer and yet the brain has
an electrical output of just 20 Watts
enough to power a very dim light bulb
you can see just how delicate and
fragile it is I'll just point out a
couple of features this is the frontal
lobe the command and control center of
the brain while this projection down
here is the temporal lobe involved in
language emotion and memory the brain is
a masterpiece of evolution and biology
and yet despite all our scientific
knowledge there's still a huge amount we
don't know about how the brain works and
why it sometimes goes wrong
